074/**
075 *  The implementation of
076 *  {@link CodeBlock}
077 *  for a fragment of a {@code *.java} file.
078 *
079 *  @author Square,Inc.
080 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
081 *  @version $Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $
082 *  @since 0.0.5
083 *
084 *  @UMLGraph.link
085 */
086@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $" )
087@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
088public final class CodeBlockImpl implements CodeBlock
089{
090        /*---------------*\
091    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
092        \*---------------*/
093    /**
094     *  The implementation of
095     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.CodeBlock.Builder}
096     *  as the builder for a new
097     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
098     *  instance.
099     *
100     *  @author Square,Inc.
101     *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
102     *  @version $Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $
103     *  @since 0.0.5
104     *
105     *  @UMLGraph.link
106     */
107    @SuppressWarnings( {"OverlyComplexClass"} )
108    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $" )
109    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
110    public static final class BuilderImpl implements CodeBlock.Builder
111    {
112            /*------------*\
113        ====** Attributes **===================================================
114            \*------------*/
115        /**
116         *  The arguments.
117         */
118        private final Collection<Object> m_Args = new ArrayList<>();
119
120        /**
121         *  The reference to the factory.
122         */
123        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
124        private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
125
126        /**
127         *  The format Strings.
128         */
129        private final List<String> m_FormatParts = new ArrayList<>();
130
131        /**
132         *  The static imports.
133         */
134        private final Collection<String> m_StaticImports = new TreeSet<>();
135
136            /*--------------*\
137        ====** Constructors **=================================================
138            \*--------------*/
139        /**
140         *  Creates a new {@code BuilderImpl} instance.
141         *
142         *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
143         *      builder instance.
144         */
145        public BuilderImpl( @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" ) final JavaComposer composer )
146        {
147            m_Composer = requireNonNullArgument( composer, "composer" );
148        }   //  BuilderImpl()
149
150        /**
151         *  Creates a new {@code BuilderImpl} instance.
152         *
153         *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
154         *      builder instance.
155         *  @param  formatParts The format parts.
156         *  @param  args    The arguments.
157         */
158        public BuilderImpl( @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" ) final JavaComposer composer, final List<String> formatParts, final List<Object> args )
159        {
160            this( composer );
161            m_FormatParts.addAll( requireNonNullArgument( formatParts, "formatParts" ) );
162            m_Args.addAll( requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ) );
163        }   //  BuilderImpl()
164
165            /*---------*\
166        ====** Methods **======================================================
167            \*---------*/
168        /**
169         *  {@inheritDoc}
170         */
171        @Override
172        public final BuilderImpl add( final CodeBlock codeBlock )
173        {
174            addDebug();
175            final var retValue = addWithoutDebugInfo( codeBlock );
176
177            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
178            return retValue;
179        }   //  add()
180
181        /**
182         *  Adds the given debug output.
183         *
184         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output.
185         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
186         *
187         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
188         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
189         */
190        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType"} )
191        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
192        public final BuilderImpl add( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput )
193        {
194            requireNonNullArgument( debugOutput, "debugOutput" ).ifPresent( v -> m_FormatParts.add( v.asComment() ) );
195
196            //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
197            return this;
198        }   //  add()
199
200        /**
201         *  {@inheritDoc}
202         *
203         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
204         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
205         */
206        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal"} )
207        @Override
208        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
209        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
210        public final BuilderImpl add( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
211        {
212            return add( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), format, args );
213        }   //  add()
214
215        /**
216         *  <p>{@summary Adds code with positional or relative arguments.}</p>
217         *  <p>Relative arguments map 1:1 with the placeholders in the format
218         *  string.</p>
219         *  <p>Positional arguments use an index after the placeholder to
220         *  identify which argument index to use. For example, for a literal to
221         *  reference the 3<sup>rd</sup> argument, use {@code "$3L"} (1 based
222         *  index).</p>
223         *  <p>Mixing relative and positional arguments in a call to add is
224         *  invalid and will result in an error.</p>
225         *
226         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
227         *      code.
228         *  @param  format  The format; may be empty.
229         *  @param  args    The arguments.
230         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
231         *
232         *  @since 0.0.6
233         *
234         *  @deprecated We do no longer expose the debug output generation.
235         */
236        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
237        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "OverlyComplexMethod", "LocalVariableNamingConvention", "CharacterComparison"} )
238        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
239        public final BuilderImpl add( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
240        {
241            add( debugOutput );
242
243            var hasRelative = false;
244            var hasIndexed = false;
245            var relativeParameterCount = 0;
246
247            final var length = requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ).length();
248            final var indexedParameterCount = new int [requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).length];
249
250            ParseLoop:
251            //noinspection ForLoopWithMissingComponent
252            for( var pos = 0; pos < length; /* Update is inside the loop body */ )
253            {
254                if( format.charAt( pos ) != '$' )
255                {
256                    var nextPos = format.indexOf( '$', pos + 1 );
257                    if( nextPos == -1 ) nextPos = format.length();
258                    m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( pos, nextPos ) );
259                    pos = nextPos;
260                    continue ParseLoop;
261                }
262
263                //---* The update for the for-loop … *-------------------------
264                ++pos ; // '$'.
265
266                /*
267                 * Consume zero or more digits, leaving 'c' as the first
268                 * non-digit char after the '$'.
269                 */
270                final var indexStart = pos;
271                char c;
272                do
273                {
274                    checkState( pos < format.length(), () -> new ValidationException( "dangling format characters in '%s'".formatted( format ) ) );
275                    c = format.charAt( pos++ );
276                }
277                while( c >= '0' && c <= '9' );
278                final var indexEnd = pos - 1;
279
280                //---* If 'c' doesn't take an argument, we're done *-----------
281                if( isNoArgPlaceholder( c ) )
282                {
283                    checkState( indexStart == indexEnd, () -> new ValidationException( "$$, $>, $<, $[, $], $W, and $Z may not have an index" ) );
284                    m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
285                    continue ParseLoop;
286                }
287
288                /*
289                 * Find either the indexed argument, or the relative argument
290                 * (0-based).
291                 */
292                final int index;
293                if( indexStart < indexEnd )
294                {
295                    index = Integer.parseInt( format.substring( indexStart, indexEnd ) ) - 1;
296                    hasIndexed = true;
297                    if( args.length > 0 )
298                    {
299                        //---* modulo is needed, checked below anyway *--------
300                        ++indexedParameterCount [index % args.length];
301                    }
302                }
303                else
304                {
305                    index = relativeParameterCount++;
306                    hasRelative = true;
307                }
308
309                checkState( index >= 0 && index < args.length, () -> new ValidationException( "index %d for '%s' not in range (received %s arguments)".formatted( index + 1, format.substring( indexStart - 1, indexEnd + 1 ), args.length ) ) );
310                checkState( !hasIndexed || !hasRelative, () -> new ValidationException( "cannot mix indexed and positional parameters" ) );
311
312                addArgument( format, c, args [index] );
313
314                m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
315            }   //  ParseLoop:
316
317            if( hasRelative && (relativeParameterCount < args.length) )
318            {
319                throw new ValidationException( "unused arguments: expected %s, received %s".formatted( relativeParameterCount, args.length ) );
320            }
321            if( hasIndexed )
322            {
323                final Collection<String> unused = IntStream.range( 0, args.length )
324                    .filter( i -> indexedParameterCount[i] == 0 )
325                    .mapToObj( i -> "$" + (i + 1) )
326                    .collect( toList() );
327                final var s = unused.size() == 1 ? "" : "s";
328                if( !unused.isEmpty() )
329                {
330                    throw new ValidationException( "unused argument%s: %s".formatted( s, String.join( ", ", unused ) ) );
331                }
332            }
333
334            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
335            return this;
336        }   //  add()
337
338        /**
339         *  {@inheritDoc}
340         */
341        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
342        @Override
343        public final BuilderImpl add( final String format, final Object... args )
344        {
345            addDebug();
346
347            final var retValue = addWithoutDebugInfo( format, args );
348
349            //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
350            return retValue;
351        }   //  add()
352
353        /**
354         *  Adds the placeholder's argument.
355         *
356         *  @param  format  The format.
357         *  @param  placeholder The placeholder character.
358         *  @param  arg     The argument.
359         */
360        private final void addArgument( final String format, final char placeholder, final Object arg )
361        {
362            final var argument = switch( placeholder )
363            {
364                case 'N' -> argToName( arg );
365                case 'L' -> argToLiteral( arg );
366                case 'S' -> argToString( arg );
367                case 'T' -> argToType( arg );
368                default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "invalid format string: '%s'", format ) );
369            };
370            m_Args.add( argument );
371        }   //  addArgument()
372
373        /**
374         *  Adds debug output.
375         */
376        private final void addDebug()
377        {
378            createDebugOutput( m_Composer.addDebugOutput() )
379                .ifPresent( v -> m_FormatParts.add( v.asComment() ) );
380        }   //  addDebug()
381
382        /**
383         *  {@inheritDoc}
384         *
385         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
386         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
387         */
388        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal"} )
389        @Override
390        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
391        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
392        public final BuilderImpl addNamed( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String format, final Map<String,?> args )
393        {
394            return addNamed( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), format, args );
395        }   //  addNamed()
396
397        /**
398         *  <p>{@summary Adds code using named arguments.}</p>
399         *  <p>Named arguments specify their name after the '$' followed by a
400         *  colon {@code ":"} and the corresponding type character. Argument
401         *  names consist of characters in {@code a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and _} and
402         *  must start with a lowercase character.</p>
403         *  <p>For example, to refer to the type
404         *  {@link java.lang.Integer}
405         *  with the argument name {@code clazz} use a format string containing
406         *  {@code $clazz:T} and include the key {@code clazz} with value
407         *  {@code java.lang.Integer.class} in the argument map.</p>
408         *
409         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
410         *      code.
411         *  @param  format  The format.
412         *  @param  args    The arguments.
413         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
414         *
415         *  @since 0.0.6
416         *
417         *  @deprecated We do no longer expose the debug output generation.
418         */
419        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
420        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "LocalVariableNamingConvention"} )
421        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
422        public final BuilderImpl addNamed( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Map<String,?> args )
423        {
424            add( debugOutput );
425
426            for( final var argument : requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).keySet() )
427            {
428                checkState( LOWERCASE.matcher( argument ).matches(), () -> new ValidationException( "argument '%s' must start with a lowercase character".formatted( argument ) ) );
429            }
430            if( isNotEmpty( requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ) ) )
431            {
432                var p = 0;
433                ParseLoop: while( p < format.length() )
434                {
435                    final var nextP = format.indexOf( "$", p );
436                    if( nextP == -1 )
437                    {
438                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p ) );
439                        break ParseLoop;
440                    }
441
442                    if( p != nextP )
443                    {
444                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p, nextP ) );
445                        p = nextP;
446                    }
447
448                    Matcher matcher = null;
449                    final var colon = format.indexOf( ':', p );
450                    if( colon != -1 )
451                    {
452                        final var endIndex = min( colon + 2, format.length() );
453                        matcher = NAMED_ARGUMENT.matcher( format.substring( p, endIndex ) );
454                    }
455                    if( nonNull( matcher ) && matcher.lookingAt() )
456                    {
457                        final var argumentName = matcher.group( "argumentName" );
458                        checkState( args.containsKey( argumentName ), () -> new ValidationException( "Missing named argument for $%s".formatted( argumentName ) ) );
459                        final var formatChar = matcher.group( "typeChar" ).charAt( 0 );
460                        addArgument( format, formatChar, args.get( argumentName ) );
461                        m_FormatParts.add( "$" + formatChar );
462                        p += matcher.regionEnd();
463                    }
464                    else
465                    {
466                        checkState( p < format.length() - 1, () -> new ValidationException( "dangling $ at end" ) );
467                        if( !isNoArgPlaceholder( format.charAt( p + 1 ) ) )
468                        {
469                            throw new ValidationException( "unknown format $%s at %s in '%s'".formatted( format.charAt( p + 1 ), p + 1, format ) );
470                        }
471                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p, p + 2 ) );
472                        p += 2;
473                    }
474                }   //  ParseLoop:
475            }
476
477            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
478            return this;
479        }   //  addNamed()
480
481        /**
482         *  {@inheritDoc}
483         */
484        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
485        @Override
486        public final BuilderImpl addNamed( final String format, final Map<String,?> args )
487        {
488            addDebug();
489
490            for( final var argument : requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).keySet() )
491            {
492                checkState( LOWERCASE.matcher( argument ).matches(), () -> new ValidationException( "argument '%s' must start with a lowercase character".formatted( argument ) ) );
493            }
494            if( isNotEmpty( requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ) ) )
495            {
496                var currentPos = 0;
497                ParseLoop: while( currentPos < format.length() )
498                {
499                    final var nextPos = format.indexOf( "$", currentPos );
500                    if( nextPos == -1 )
501                    {
502                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( currentPos ) );
503                        break ParseLoop;
504                    }
505
506                    if( currentPos != nextPos )
507                    {
508                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( currentPos, nextPos ) );
509                        currentPos = nextPos;
510                    }
511
512                    Matcher matcher = null;
513                    final var colon = format.indexOf( ':', currentPos );
514                    if( colon != -1 )
515                    {
516                        final var endIndex = min( colon + 2, format.length() );
517                        matcher = NAMED_ARGUMENT.matcher( format.substring( currentPos, endIndex ) );
518                    }
519                    if( nonNull( matcher ) && matcher.lookingAt() )
520                    {
521                        final var argumentName = matcher.group( "argumentName" );
522                        checkState( args.containsKey( argumentName ), () -> new ValidationException( "Missing named argument for $%s".formatted( argumentName ) ) );
523                        final var formatChar = matcher.group( "typeChar" ).charAt( 0 );
524                        addArgument( format, formatChar, args.get( argumentName ) );
525                        m_FormatParts.add( "$" + formatChar );
526                        currentPos += matcher.regionEnd();
527                    }
528                    else
529                    {
530                        checkState( currentPos < format.length() - 1, () -> new ValidationException( "dangling $ at end" ) );
531                        if( !isNoArgPlaceholder( format.charAt( currentPos + 1 ) ) )
532                        {
533                            throw new ValidationException( "unknown format $%s at %s in '%s'".formatted( format.charAt( currentPos + 1 ), currentPos + 1, format ) );
534                        }
535                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( currentPos, currentPos + 2 ) );
536                        currentPos += 2;
537                    }
538                }   //  ParseLoop:
539            }
540
541            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
542            return this;
543        }   //  addNamed()
544
545        /**
546         *  {@inheritDoc}
547         */
548        @Override
549        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final CodeBlock codeBlock )
550        {
551            addStatement( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, "$L", requireNonNullArgument( codeBlock, "codeBlock" ) );
552            m_StaticImports.addAll( ((CodeBlockImpl) codeBlock).getStaticImports() );
553
554            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
555            return this;
556        }   //  addStatement()
557
558        /**
559         *  {@inheritDoc}
560         *
561         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
562         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
563         */
564        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal"} )
565        @Override
566        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
567        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
568        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
569        {
570            return addStatement( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), format, args );
571        }   //  addStatement()
572
573        /**
574         *  <p>{@summary Adds a statement.}</p>
575         *  <p>Do not use this method when the resulting code should be used
576         *  as a field initializer. Use
577         *  {@link #add(String, Object...)}
578         *  instead.</p>
579         *
580         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
581         *      code.
582         *  @param  format  The format.
583         *  @param  args    The arguments.
584         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
585         *
586         *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.FieldSpec.Builder#initializer(CodeBlock)
587         *
588         *  @since 0.0.6
589         *
590         *  @deprecated We do no longer expose the debug output generation.
591         */
592        @Deprecated( since ="0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
593        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType"} )
594        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
595        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
596        {
597            return add( debugOutput, "$[" ).add( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, format, args ).add( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, ";\n$]" );
598        }   //  addStatement()
599
600        /**
601         *  {@inheritDoc}
602         */
603        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
604        @Override
605        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final String format, final Object... args )
606        {
607            final var retValue = add( "$[" )
608                .addWithoutDebugInfo( format, args )
609                .addWithoutDebugInfo( ";\n$]" );
610
611            //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
612            return retValue;
613        }   //  addStatement()
614
615        /**
616         *  {@inheritDoc}
617         */
618        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
619        @Override
620        public final BuilderImpl addStaticImport( final Class<?> clazz, final String... names )
621        {
622            return addStaticImport( ClassNameImpl.from( clazz ), names );
623        }   //  addStaticImport()
624
625        /**
626         *  {@inheritDoc}
627         */
628        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
629        @Override
630        public final BuilderImpl addStaticImport( final ClassName className, final String... names )
631        {
632            final var canonicalName = requireNonNullArgument( className, "className" ).canonicalName();
633            for( final var name : requireValidNonNullArgument( names, "names", v -> v.length > 0, "%s array is empty"::formatted ) )
634            {
635                m_StaticImports.add(
636                    format(
637                        "%s.%s",
638                        canonicalName,
639                        requireValidArgument(
640                            name,
641                            "name",
642                            Objects::nonNull,
643                            $ -> "null entry in names array: %s".formatted( Arrays.toString( names ) )
644                        )
645                    )
646                );
647            }
648
649            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
650            return this;
651        }   //  addStaticImport()
652
653        /**
654         *  {@inheritDoc}
655         */
656        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
657        @Override
658        public final BuilderImpl addStaticImport( final Enum<?> constant )
659        {
660            return addStaticImport( ClassNameImpl.from( requireNonNullArgument( constant, "constant" ).getDeclaringClass() ), constant.name() );
661        }   //  addStaticImport()
662
663        /**
664         *  Adds a
665         *  {@link CodeBlock}
666         *  instance without prepending any debug output.
667         *
668         *  @param  codeBlock   The code block.
669         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
670         */
671        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface"} )
672        public final BuilderImpl addWithoutDebugInfo( final CodeBlock codeBlock )
673        {
674            final var builder = (BuilderImpl) requireNonNullArgument( codeBlock, "codeBlock" )
675                .toBuilder();
676            m_FormatParts.addAll( builder.formatParts() );
677            m_Args.addAll( builder.args() );
678            m_StaticImports.addAll( ((CodeBlockImpl) codeBlock).getStaticImports() );
679
680            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
681            return this;
682        }   //  addWithoutDebugInfo()
683
684        /**
685         *  <p>{@summary Adds code with positional or relative arguments,
686         *  without prepending any debug output.}</p>
687         *  <p>Relative arguments map 1:1 with the placeholders in the format
688         *  string.</p>
689         *  <p>Positional arguments use an index after the placeholder to
690         *  identify which argument index to use. For example, for a literal to
691         *  reference the 3<sup>rd</sup> argument, use {@code "$3L"} (1 based
692         *  index).</p>
693         *  <p>Mixing relative and positional arguments in a call to add is
694         *  illegal and will result in an error.</p>
695         *
696         *  @param  format  The format; may be empty.
697         *  @param  args    The arguments.
698         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
699         */
700        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OverlyComplexMethod", "CharacterComparison"} )
701        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
702        public final BuilderImpl addWithoutDebugInfo( final String format, final Object... args )
703        {
704            var hasRelative = false;
705            var hasIndexed = false;
706            var relativeParameterCount = 0;
707
708            final var length = requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ).length();
709            final var indexedParameterCount = new int [requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).length];
710
711            ParseLoop:
712            //noinspection ForLoopWithMissingComponent
713            for( var pos = 0; pos < length; /* Update is inside the loop body */ )
714            {
715                if( format.charAt( pos ) != '$' )
716                {
717                    var nextPos = format.indexOf( '$', pos + 1 );
718                    if( nextPos == -1 ) nextPos = format.length();
719                    m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( pos, nextPos ) );
720                    pos = nextPos;
721                    continue ParseLoop;
722                }
723
724                //---* The update for the for-loop … *-------------------------
725                ++pos ; // '$'.
726
727                /*
728                 * Consume zero or more digits, leaving 'c' as the first
729                 * non-digit char after the '$'.
730                 */
731                final var indexStart = pos;
732                @SuppressWarnings( "LocalVariableNamingConvention" )
733                char c;
734                do
735                {
736                    checkState( pos < format.length(), () -> new ValidationException( "dangling format characters in '%s'".formatted( format ) ) );
737                    c = format.charAt( pos++ );
738                }
739                while( c >= '0' && c <= '9' );
740                final var indexEnd = pos - 1;
741
742                //---* If 'c' doesn't take an argument, we're done *-----------
743                if( isNoArgPlaceholder( c ) )
744                {
745                    checkState( indexStart == indexEnd, () -> new ValidationException( "$$, $>, $<, $[, $], $W, and $Z may not have an index" ) );
746                    m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
747                    continue ParseLoop;
748                }
749
750                /*
751                 * Find either the indexed argument, or the relative argument
752                 * (0-based).
753                 */
754                final int index;
755                if( indexStart < indexEnd )
756                {
757                    index = Integer.parseInt( format.substring( indexStart, indexEnd ) ) - 1;
758                    hasIndexed = true;
759                    if( args.length > 0 )
760                    {
761                        //---* modulo is needed, checked below anyway *--------
762                        ++indexedParameterCount [index % args.length];
763                    }
764                }
765                else
766                {
767                    index = relativeParameterCount++;
768                    hasRelative = true;
769                }
770
771                checkState( index >= 0 && index < args.length, () -> new ValidationException( "index %d for '%s' not in range (received %s arguments)".formatted( index + 1, format.substring( indexStart - 1, indexEnd + 1 ), args.length ) ) );
772                checkState( !hasIndexed || !hasRelative, () -> new ValidationException(  "cannot mix indexed and positional parameters" ) );
773
774                addArgument( format, c, args [index] );
775
776                m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
777            }   //  ParseLoop:
778
779            if( hasRelative && (relativeParameterCount < args.length) )
780            {
781                throw new ValidationException( "unused arguments: expected %s, received %s".formatted( relativeParameterCount, args.length ) );
782            }
783            if( hasIndexed )
784            {
785                final Collection<String> unused = IntStream.range( 0, args.length )
786                    .filter( i -> indexedParameterCount[i] == 0 )
787                    .mapToObj( i -> "$" + (i + 1) )
788                    .collect( toList() );
789                if( !unused.isEmpty() )
790                {
791                    throw new ValidationException( "unused argument%s: %s".formatted( unused.size() == 1 ? "" : "s", String.join( ", ", unused ) ) );
792                }
793            }
794
795            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
796            return this;
797        }   //  addWithoutDebugInfo()
798
799        /**
800         *  Returns the arguments.
801         *
802         *  @return The arguments.
803         */
804        @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
805        public final List<Object> args() { return List.copyOf( m_Args ); }
806
807        /**
808         *  Returns the given object literally.
809         *
810         *  @param  o   The object.
811         *  @return The literal.
812         */
813        private static final Object argToLiteral( final Object o )
814        {
815            final var retValue = nonNull( o ) ? o : NULL_REFERENCE;
816
817            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
818            return retValue;
819        }   //  argToLiteral()
820
821        /**
822         *  Translates the given object to a name.
823         *
824         *  @param  o   The object.
825         *  @return The name.
826         */
827        private static final Object argToName( final Object o )
828        {
829            final var retValue = switch( o )
830                {
831                    case final CharSequence charSequence -> charSequence.toString();
832                    case final ParameterSpec parameterSpec -> parameterSpec.name();
833                    case final FieldSpec fieldSpec -> fieldSpec.name();
834                    case final MethodSpec methodSpec -> methodSpec.name();
835                    case final TypeSpec typeSpec ->
836                        /*
837                         * Does not work for anonymous types, so no check for the name
838                         * is required.
839                         */
840                        //noinspection OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent
841                        typeSpec.name().get();
842                    case null, default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException( "expected name but was " + o );
843                };
844
845            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
846            return retValue;
847        }   //  argToName()
848
849        /**
850         *  Translates the given object to a String.
851         *
852         *  @param  o   The object.
853         *  @return The resulting String, or
854         *      {@link Util#NULL_REFERENCE}
855         *      if the object is
856         *      {@code null}.
857         */
858        private static final Object argToString( final Object o )
859        {
860            final var retValue = isNull( o ) ? NULL_REFERENCE : Objects.toString( o );
861
862            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
863            return retValue;
864        }   //  argToString()
865
866        /**
867         *  Translates the given object to a type.
868         *
869         *  @param  o   The object.
870         *  @return The resulting type.
871         */
872        private static final TypeNameImpl argToType( final Object o )
873        {
874            final var retValue = switch( o )
875                {
876                    case final TypeNameImpl typeName -> typeName;
877                    case final TypeMirror typeMirror -> TypeNameImpl.from( typeMirror );
878                    case final Element element -> TypeNameImpl.from( element.asType() );
879                    case final Type type -> TypeNameImpl.from( type );
880                    case null, default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException( "expected type but was " + o );
881                };
882
883            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
884            return retValue;
885        }   //  argToType()
886
887        /**
888         *  {@inheritDoc}
889         *
890         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
891         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
892         */
893        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal"} )
894        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
895        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
896        @Override
897        public final BuilderImpl beginControlFlow( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
898        {
899            return beginControlFlow( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), controlFlow, args );
900        }   //  beginControlFlow()
901
902        /**
903         *  Starts a control flow construct.
904         *
905         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
906         *      code.
907         *  @param  controlFlow The control flow construct and its code, such
908         *      as {@code if (foo == 5)}.<br>
909         *      <br>Shouldn't contain braces or newline characters.
910         *  @param  args    The arguments.
911         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
912         *
913         *  @since 0.0.6
914         *
915         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
916         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
917         */
918        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
919        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
920        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType"} )
921        public final BuilderImpl beginControlFlow( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
922        {
923            if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) ) )
924            {
925                add( debugOutput, controlFlow, args );
926                if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) add( " " );
927                add( "{\n" );
928            }
929            else
930            {
931                add( debugOutput, "{\n" );
932            }
933            indent();
934
935            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
936            return this;
937        }   //  beginControlFlow()
938
939        /**
940         *  {@inheritDoc}
941         */
942        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
943        @Override
944        public final BuilderImpl beginControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
945        {
946            addDebug();
947            if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) ) )
948            {
949                addWithoutDebugInfo( controlFlow, args );
950                if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) addWithoutDebugInfo( " " );
951            }
952            addWithoutDebugInfo( "{\n" );
953            indent();
954
955            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
956            return this;
957        }   //  beginControlFlow()
958
959        /**
960         *  {@inheritDoc}
961         */
962        @Override
963        public final CodeBlockImpl build() { return new CodeBlockImpl( this ); }
964
965        /**
966         *  {@inheritDoc}
967         */
968        @Override
969        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow()
970        {
971            addDebug();
972            unindent();
973            addWithoutDebugInfo( "}\n" );
974
975            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
976            return this;
977        }   //  endControlFlow()
978
979        /**
980         *  {@inheritDoc}
981         *
982         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
983         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
984         */
985        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal"} )
986        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
987        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
988        @Override
989        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
990        {
991            return endControlFlow( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), controlFlow, args );
992        }   //  endControlFlow()
993
994        /**
995         *  <p>{@summary Ends a control flow construct that was previously
996         *  started with a call to
997         *  {@link #beginControlFlow(String, Object...)}
998         *  or
999         *  {@link #beginControlFlow(boolean, String, Object...)}.}</p>
1000         *  <p>This form is only used for {@code do/while} control flows.</p>
1001         *
1002         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
1003         *      code.
1004         *  @param controlFlow  The optional control flow construct and its
1005         *      code, such as {@code while(foo == 20)}.
1006         *  @param  args    The arguments.
1007         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
1008         *
1009         *  @since 0.0.6
1010         *
1011         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1012         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1013         */
1014        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType"} )
1015        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1016        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1017        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1018        {
1019            unindent();
1020            add( debugOutput, "} " + requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) + ";\n", args );
1021
1022            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1023            return this;
1024        }   //  endControlFlow()
1025
1026        /**
1027         *  {@inheritDoc}
1028         */
1029        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
1030        @Override
1031        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1032        {
1033            addDebug();
1034            unindent();
1035            addWithoutDebugInfo( "} " + requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) + ";\n", args );
1036
1037            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1038            return this;
1039        }   //  endControlFlow()
1040
1041        /**
1042         *  Returns the format parts.
1043         *
1044         *  @return The format parts.
1045         */
1046        @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1047        public final List<String> formatParts() { return List.copyOf( m_FormatParts ); }
1048
1049        /**
1050         *  {@inheritDoc}
1051         */
1052        @Override
1053        public final BuilderImpl indent()
1054        {
1055            m_FormatParts.add( "$>" );
1056
1057            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1058            return this;
1059        }   //  indent()
1060
1061        /**
1062         *  {@inheritDoc}
1063         */
1064        @Override
1065        public final boolean isEmpty() { return m_FormatParts.isEmpty(); }
1066
1067        /**
1068         *  Checks whether the given placeholder character would expect an
1069         *  argument.
1070         *
1071         *  @param  placeholder The placeholder character.
1072         *  @return {@code true} if there is no argument expected,
1073         *      {@code false} otherwise.
1074         */
1075        private static final boolean isNoArgPlaceholder( final char placeholder )
1076        {
1077            final var retValue = IntStream.of( '$', '>', '<', '[', ']', 'W', 'Z' )
1078                .anyMatch( p -> p == placeholder );
1079
1080            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1081            return retValue;
1082        }   //  isNoArgPlaceholder()
1083
1084        /**
1085         *  {@inheritDoc}
1086         *
1087         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1088         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1089         */
1090        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal"} )
1091        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1092        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1093        @Override
1094        public final BuilderImpl nextControlFlow( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1095        {
1096            return nextControlFlow( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), controlFlow, args );
1097        }   //  nextControlFlow()
1098
1099        /**
1100         *  Adds another control flow construct to an already existing one.
1101         *
1102         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
1103         *      code.
1104         *  @param controlFlow  The control flow construct and its code, such
1105         *      as {@code else if (foo == 10)}.<br>
1106         *      <br>Shouldn't contain braces or newline characters.
1107         *  @param  args    The arguments.
1108         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
1109         *
1110         *  @since 0.0.6
1111         *
1112         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1113         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1114         */
1115        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType"} )
1116        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1117        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1118        public final BuilderImpl nextControlFlow( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1119        {
1120            unindent();
1121            add( "}" );
1122            if( !requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ).startsWith( "\n" ) ) add( " " );
1123            add( debugOutput, controlFlow, args );
1124            if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) add(" " );
1125            add( "{\n" );
1126            indent();
1127
1128            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1129            return this;
1130        }   //  nextControlFlow()
1131
1132        /**
1133         *  {@inheritDoc}
1134         */
1135        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
1136        @Override
1137        public final BuilderImpl nextControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1138        {
1139            unindent();
1140            addWithoutDebugInfo( "}" );
1141            if( !requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ).startsWith( "\n" ) ) addWithoutDebugInfo( " " );
1142            add( controlFlow, args );
1143            if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) addWithoutDebugInfo(" " );
1144            addWithoutDebugInfo( "{\n" );
1145            indent();
1146
1147            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1148            return this;
1149        }   //  nextControlFlow()
1150
1151        /**
1152         *  {@inheritDoc}
1153         */
1154        @Override
1155        public final BuilderImpl unindent()
1156        {
1157            m_FormatParts.add( "$<" );
1158
1159            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1160            return this;
1161        }   //  unindent()
1162    }

1165    /**
1166     *  A helper class that supports to join code blocks.
1167     *
1168     *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
1169     *  @version $Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $
1170     *  @since 0.0.5
1171     *
1172     *  @UMLGraph.link
1173     */
1174    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $" )
1175    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
1176    private static final class CodeBlockJoiner
1177    {
1178            /*------------*\
1179        ====** Attributes **===================================================
1180            \*------------*/
1181        /**
1182         *  The builder that is used to deliver the final code block.
1183         */
1184        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1185        private final BuilderImpl m_Builder;
1186
1187        /**
1188         *  The separator for the joined code blocks.
1189         */
1190        private final String m_Delimiter;
1191
1192        /**
1193         *  Flag that indicates whether to add the delimiter on adding a new
1194         *  code block.
1195         */
1196        private boolean m_First = true;
1197
1198            /*--------------*\
1199        ====** Constructors **=================================================
1200            \*--------------*/
1201        /**
1202         *  Creates a new {@code CodeBlockJoiner} instance.
1203         *
1204         *  @param  delimiter   The separator for the joined code blocks.
1205         *  @param  builder The builder that is used to deliver the final code
1206         *      block.
1207         */
1208        public CodeBlockJoiner( final String delimiter, @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" ) final BuilderImpl builder )
1209        {
1210            m_Delimiter = requireNonNullArgument( delimiter, "delimiter" );
1211            m_Builder = requireNonNullArgument( builder, "builder" );
1212        }   //  CodeBlockJoiner()
1213
1214            /*---------*\
1215        ====** Methods **======================================================
1216            \*---------*/
1217        /**
1218         *  Adds another code block.
1219         *
1220         *  @param  codeBlock   The new code block.
1221         *  @return This {@code CodeBlockJoiner} instance.
1222         */
1223        @SuppressWarnings( {"TypeMayBeWeakened", "UnusedReturnValue"} )
1224        public final CodeBlockJoiner add( @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" ) final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock )
1225        {
1226            if( !m_First ) m_Builder.addWithoutDebugInfo( m_Delimiter );
1227            m_First = false;
1228
1229            m_Builder.add( codeBlock );
1230
1231            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1232            return this;
1233        }   //  add()
1234
1235        /**
1236         *  Returns the new code block with the joined ones.
1237         *
1238         *  @return The new code block.
1239         */
1240        public final CodeBlockImpl join() { return m_Builder.build(); }
1241
1242        /**
1243         *  Merges this code block joiner with the given other one.
1244         *
1245         *  @param  other   The other code block joiner.
1246         *  @return This {@code CodeBlockJoiner} instance.
1247         */
1248        public final CodeBlockJoiner merge( @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" ) final CodeBlockJoiner other )
1249        {
1250            final var otherBlock = requireNonNullArgument( other, "other" ).m_Builder.build();
1251            if( !otherBlock.isEmpty() ) add( otherBlock );
1252
1253            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1254            return this;
1255        }   //  merge()
1256    }
1257    //  class CodeBlockJoiner
1258
1259        /*------------*\
1260    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
1261        \*------------*/
1262    /**
1263     *  The arguments.
1264     */
1265    private final List<Object> m_Args;
1266
1267    /**
1268     *  Lazily initialised return value of
1269     *  {@link #toString()}
1270     *  for this code block.
1271     */
1272    private final Lazy<String> m_CachedString;
1273
1274    /**
1275     *  The reference to the factory.
1276     */
1277    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1278    private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
1279
1280    /**
1281     *  A heterogeneous list containing string literals and value placeholders.
1282     */
1283    private final List<String> m_FormatParts;
1284
1285    /**
1286     *  The static imports.
1287     */
1288    private final Set<String> m_StaticImports;
1289
1290        /*------------------------*\
1291    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
1292        \*------------------------*/
1293    /**
1294     *  The regular expression that is used to determine whether a parameter
1295     *  name starts with a lowercase character.
1296     */
1297    public static final Pattern LOWERCASE;
1298
1299    /**
1300     *  The regular expression that is used to obtain the argument name from
1301     *  a format string.
1302     */
1303    public static final Pattern NAMED_ARGUMENT;
1304
1305    static
1306    {
1307        try
1308        {
1309            LOWERCASE = Pattern.compile( "[a-z]+[\\w_]*" );
1310            NAMED_ARGUMENT = Pattern.compile( "\\$(?<argumentName>[\\w_]+):(?<typeChar>\\w).*" );
1311        }
1312        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
1313        {
1314            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError( e );
1315        }
1316    }
1317
1318        /*--------------*\
1319    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
1320        \*--------------*/
1321    /**
1322     *  Creates a new {@code CodeBlockImpl} instance.
1323     *
1324     *  @param  builder The builder for this instance.
1325     */
1326    @SuppressWarnings( {"AccessingNonPublicFieldOfAnotherObject"} )
1327    public CodeBlockImpl( @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" ) final BuilderImpl builder )
1328    {
1329        m_Composer = builder.m_Composer;
1330        m_FormatParts = builder.formatParts();
1331        m_Args = builder.args();
1332        m_StaticImports = Set.copyOf( builder.m_StaticImports );
1333
1334        m_CachedString = Lazy.use( this::initialiseCachedString );
1335    }   //  CodeBlockImpl()
1336
1337        /*---------*\
1338    ====** Methods **==========================================================
1339        \*---------*/
1340    /**
1341     *  Returns the arguments.
1342     *
1343     *  @return The arguments.
1344     */
1345    /*
1346     * Originally, this was the reference to the internal collection!
1347     */
1348    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1349    public final List<Object> args() { return List.copyOf( m_Args ); }
1350
1351    /**
1352     *  Creates a builder for an instance of {@code CodeBlock}.
1353     *
1354     *  @return The new builder.
1355     *
1356     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1357     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1358     */
1359    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1360    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1361    public static BuilderImpl builder() { return new BuilderImpl( new JavaComposer() ); }
1362
1363    /**
1364     *  {@inheritDoc}
1365     */
1366    @Override
1367    public final boolean equals( final Object o )
1368    {
1369        var retValue = this == o;
1370        if( !retValue && (o instanceof final CodeBlockImpl other) )
1371        {
1372            retValue = m_Composer.equals( other.m_Composer ) && toString().equals( o.toString() );
1373        }
1374
1375        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1376        return retValue;
1377    }   //  equals()

1380     *  Returns the format parts from this code block.
1381     *
1382     *  @return The format parts.
1383     */
1384    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1385    public final List<String> formatParts() { return List.copyOf( m_FormatParts ); }

1389     *  {@link JavaComposer}
1390     *  factory.
1391     *
1392     *  @return The reference to the factory.
1393     */
1394    @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface"} )
1395    public final JavaComposer getFactory() { return m_Composer; }

1398     *  Returns the static imports for this code block.
1399     *
1400     *  @return The static imports.
1401     */
1402    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1403    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
1404    public final Set<String> getStaticImports() { return m_StaticImports; }
1405
1406    /**
1407     *  {@inheritDoc}
1408     */
1409    @Override
1410    public final int hashCode() { return toString().hashCode(); }
1411
1412    /**
1413     *  The initializer for
1414     *  {@link #m_CachedString}.
1415     *
1416     *  @return The return value for
1417     *      {@link #toString()}.
1418     */
1419    private final String initialiseCachedString()
1420    {
1421        final var resultBuilder = new StringBuilder();
1422        final var codeWriter = new CodeWriter( m_Composer, resultBuilder );
1423        try
1424        {
1425            codeWriter.emit( this );
1426        }
1427        catch( final UncheckedIOException e )
1428        {
1429            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e.getCause() );
1430        }
1431        final var retValue = resultBuilder.toString();
1432
1433        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1434        return retValue;
1435    }   //  initialiseCachedString()
1436
1437    /**
1438     *  {@inheritDoc}
1439     */
1440    @Override
1441    public final boolean isEmpty() { return m_FormatParts.isEmpty(); }
1442
1443    /**
1444     * {@inheritDoc}
1445     */
1446    @Override
1447    public final CodeBlock join( final String separator, final CodeBlock... codeBlocks )
1448    {
1449        final var retValue = makeCodeBlockStream( this, requireNonNullArgument( codeBlocks, "codeBlocks" ) )
1450            .collect( joining( separator ) );
1451
1452        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1453        return retValue;
1454    }   //  join()
1455
1456    /**
1457     * <p>{@summary Joins this code block with the given code blocks into a
1458     * single new {@code CodeBlock} instance, each separated by the given
1459     * separator.} The given prefix will be prepended to the new
1460     * {@code CodeBloc}, and the given suffix will be appended to it.</p>
1461     * <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1462     * &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1463     * &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1464     * &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1465     *
1466     * @param separator The separator.
1467     * @param prefix The prefix.
1468     * @param suffix The suffix.
1469     * @param codeBlocks The code blocks to join.
1470     * @return The new code block.
1471     */
1472    @Override
1473    public final CodeBlock join( final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix, final CodeBlock... codeBlocks )
1474    {
1475        final var retValue = makeCodeBlockStream( this, requireNonNullArgument( codeBlocks, "codeBlocks" ) )
1476            .collect( joining( separator, prefix, suffix ) );
1477
1478        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1479        return retValue;
1480    }   //  join()
1481
1482    /**
1483     *  <p>{@summary Joins the given code blocks into a single
1484     *  {@code CodeBlockImpl} instance, each separated the given
1485     *  separator.}</p>
1486     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1487     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1488     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1489     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1490     *
1491     *  @param  codeBlocks  The code blocks to join.
1492     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1493     *  @return The new code block.
1494     *
1495     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1496     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1497     */
1498    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1499    public static final CodeBlockImpl join( final Iterable<CodeBlock> codeBlocks, final String separator )
1500    {
1501        final var retValue = StreamSupport.stream( codeBlocks.spliterator(), false )
1502            .map( codeBlock -> (CodeBlockImpl) codeBlock )
1503            .collect( joiningStatic( separator ) );
1504
1505        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1506        return retValue;
1507    }   //  join()
1508
1509    /**
1510     *  <p>{@summary Joins the given code blocks into a single
1511     *  {@code CodeBlock} instance, each separated the given separator. The
1512     *  given prefix will be prepended to the new {@code CodeBloc}, and the
1513     *  given suffix will be appended to it.}</p>
1514     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1515     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1516     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1517     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1518     *
1519     *  @param  codeBlocks  The code blocks to join.
1520     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1521     *  @param  prefix  The prefix.
1522     *  @param  suffix  The suffix.
1523     *  @return The new code block.
1524     *
1525     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1526     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1527     */
1528    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1529    public static CodeBlockImpl join( final Iterable<CodeBlock> codeBlocks, final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix  )
1530    {
1531        final var retValue = StreamSupport.stream( codeBlocks.spliterator(), false )
1532            .map( codeBlock -> (CodeBlockImpl) codeBlock )
1533            .collect( joiningStatic( separator, prefix, suffix ) );
1534
1535        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1536        return retValue;
1537    }   //  join()
1538
1539    /**
1540     *  <p>{@summary A
1541     *  {@link Collector}
1542     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1543     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.}</p>
1544     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1545     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1546     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1547     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1548     *
1549     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1550     *  @return The new collector.
1551     */
1552    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1553    public final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joining( final String separator )
1554    {
1555        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1556        (
1557            () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, new BuilderImpl( m_Composer ) ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, CodeBlockJoiner::join
1558        );
1559
1560        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1561        return retValue;
1562    }   //  joining()
1563
1564    /**
1565     *  <p>{@summary A
1566     *  {@link Collector}
1567     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1568     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.} The given prefix
1569     *  will be prepended to the new {@code CodeBloc}, and the given suffix
1570     *  will be appended to it.</p>
1571     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1572     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1573     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator, and
1574     *  &quot;{@code int func( }&quot; as the prefix and &quot; {@code )}&quot;
1575     *  as the suffix respectively would produce
1576     *  &quot;{@code int func( String s, Object o, int i )}&quot;.</p>
1577     *
1578     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1579     *  @param  prefix  The prefix.
1580     *  @param  suffix  The suffix.
1581     *  @return The new collector.
1582     */
1583    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1584    public final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joining( final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix )
1585    {
1586        final var builder = new BuilderImpl( m_Composer );
1587        builder.add( "$N", prefix );
1588        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1589        (
1590            () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, builder ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, joiner ->
1591            {
1592                builder.add( m_Composer.codeBlockOf( "$N", suffix ) );
1593                return joiner.join();
1594            }
1595        );
1596
1597        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1598        return retValue;
1599    }   //  joining()
1600
1601    /**
1602     *  <p>{@summary A
1603     *  {@link Collector}
1604     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1605     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.}</p>
1606     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1607     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1608     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1609     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1610     *
1611     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1612     *  @return The new collector.
1613     *
1614     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1615     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1616     */
1617    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1618    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1619    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1620    public static final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joiningStatic( final String separator )
1621    {
1622        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1623            (
1624                () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, new BuilderImpl( new JavaComposer() ) ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, CodeBlockJoiner::join
1625            );
1626
1627        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1628        return retValue;
1629    }   //  joiningStatic()
1630
1631    /**
1632     *  <p>{@summary A
1633     *  {@link Collector}
1634     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1635     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.} The given prefix
1636     *  will be prepended to the new {@code CodeBloc}, and the given suffix
1637     *  will be appended to it.</p>
1638     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1639     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1640     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator, and
1641     *  &quot;{@code int func( }&quot; as the prefix and &quot; {@code )}&quot;
1642     *  as the suffix respectively would produce
1643     *  &quot;{@code int func( String s, Object o, int i )}&quot;.</p>
1644     *
1645     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1646     *  @param  prefix  The prefix.
1647     *  @param  suffix  The suffix.
1648     *  @return The new collector.
1649     *
1650     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1651     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1652     */
1653    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1654    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1655    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1656    public static final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joiningStatic( final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix )
1657    {
1658        final var composer = new JavaComposer();
1659        final var builder = new BuilderImpl( composer );
1660        builder.add( "$N", prefix );
1661        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1662            (
1663                () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, builder ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, joiner ->
1664                {
1665                    builder.add( composer.codeBlockOf( "$N", suffix ) );
1666                    return joiner.join();
1667                }
1668            );
1669
1670        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1671        return retValue;
1672    }   //  joiningStatic()
1673
1674    /**
1675     *  Composes a stream from the given {@code CodeBlock} instances.
1676     *
1677     *  @param  head    The first code block.
1678     *  @param  tail    The other code blocks.
1679     *  @return The
1680     *      {@link Stream}
1681     *      instance with the {@code CodeBlock} instances.
1682     */
1683    private static final Stream<CodeBlockImpl> makeCodeBlockStream( final CodeBlock head, final CodeBlock... tail )
1684    {
1685        final var builder = Stream.<CodeBlockImpl>builder();
1686        builder.add( (CodeBlockImpl) requireNonNullArgument( head, "head" ) );
1687        for( final var block : requireNonNullArgument( tail, "tail" ) )
1688        {
1689            builder.add( (CodeBlockImpl) block );
1690        }
1691        final var retValue = builder.build();
1692
1693        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1694        return retValue;
1695    }   //  makeCodeBlockStream()
1696

1699     *  arguments.

1707     */
1708    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1709    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1710    public static final CodeBlockImpl of( final String format, final Object... args )
1711    {
1712        final var retValue = of( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, format, args );
1713
1714        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1715        return retValue;
1716    }   //  of()

1731     */
1732    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1733    @SuppressWarnings( {"OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType"} )
1734    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1735    public static final CodeBlockImpl of( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
1736    {
1737        final var retValue = builder().add( requireNonNullArgument( debugOutput, "debugOutput" ), format, args ).build();
1738
1739        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1740        return retValue;
1741    }   //  of()
1742
1743    /**
1744     *  Creates a new builder that is initialised with the components of this
1745     *  code block.
1746     *
1747     *  @return The new builder.
1748     */
1749    @SuppressWarnings( {"AccessingNonPublicFieldOfAnotherObject"} )
1750    @Override
1751    public final BuilderImpl toBuilder()
1752    {
1753        final var retValue = new BuilderImpl( m_Composer, m_FormatParts, m_Args );
1754        retValue.m_StaticImports.addAll( m_StaticImports );
1755
1756        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1757        return retValue;
1758    }   //  toBuilder()
1759
1760    /**
1761     *  {@inheritDoc}
1762     */
1763    @Override
1764    public final String toString() { return m_CachedString.get(); }
